alert.note: Alert for Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 9:49PM EDT until May 07 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Laurel, Pulaski and Rockcastle. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain still ongoing. Flooding is ongoing, especially in areas that received over 2 inches of rainfall from earlier this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Hansford, Level Green, Sand Springs, Wabp, Bloss, Bromo, Pongo, Spiro, Willailla, Quail, Wellhope, Maretburg, Valley Oak, Luner, Bandy, Burr, Ottowa, Woodstock and Bee Lick.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
